title: NIO Inc. Weekly News Summary
body:
**NIO Inc. Faces Legal Action from GIC Over Accounting Practices**

On October 22, 2025, Singapore's sovereign wealth fund, GIC, filed a lawsuit against NIO Inc., alleging improper accounting practices related to the recognition of battery sales earnings from its affiliate, Weineng. The lawsuit claims that NIO recognized these earnings upfront instead of spreading them across monthly lease payments, potentially misleading investors and inflating the company's share price. The legal action also names CEO Li Bin and former CFO Feng Wei. ([nasdaq.com](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/investment-case-nio-stock-it-faces-gic-lawsuit?utm_source=openai))

**Marex Group plc Acquires Stake in NIO Inc.**

On December 15, 2025, Marex Group plc disclosed a new position in NIO Inc., purchasing 266,984 shares valued at approximately $916,000 during the second quarter. This acquisition reflects Marex's investment interest in the electric vehicle manufacturer amid ongoing market developments. ([marketbeat.com](https://www.marketbeat.com/instant-alerts/filing-marex-group-plc-takes-916000-position-in-nio-inc-nio-2025-12-15/?utm_source=openai))

**Analyst Updates on NIO Inc.**

In recent weeks, several analysts have adjusted their ratings and price targets for NIO Inc.:

- JPMorgan upgraded NIO to an "Overweight" rating with a price target of $8.00.

- Citigroup reduced its price target to $6.90.

- Mizuho lowered its price target to $3.50.

These mixed assessments indicate varying perspectives on NIO's future performance and market position. ([marketbeat.com](https://www.marketbeat.com/instant-alerts/filing-marex-group-plc-takes-916000-position-in-nio-inc-nio-2025-12-15/?utm_source=openai))
